definition: scratch (wound)/scratch (damage to an object)
to scrape/to blow/to shave/to plunder/to extort
to blow (of the wind)
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: Protect all machined and lapped mating surfaces from damage.
sentences.chinese: 保护所有零件表面避免损害，如有刮伤须研磨。

sentences.english: No gouging or scratches permissible on "A" surfaces.
sentences.chinese: “A”表面上不可以有刨削或者是刮伤。

sentences.english: His face was slashed with a razor -blade .
sentences.chinese: 他的脸被剃须刀刮伤了。

sentences.english: The other scratch was relatively minor and probably a replacement factory decal will fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 这部份刮伤比较轻微，只要更换贴纸即可。

sentences.english: The back - side of the meter contains four (4) non - scratch nickel-plated pads.
sentences.chinese: 仪器背面有四个防刮伤的垫片。

sentences.english: With a drop of alcohol, clear the pumice and begin rubbing over all of the scratches.
sentences.chinese: 用一滴酒精，清澄浮石粉后开始涂擦所有刮伤的地方。

sentences.english: He gashed his chin badly when shaving.
sentences.chinese: 他修剪玫瑰时双手刮伤得很厉害。

sentences.english: Current development is only scratching the surface of what is possible. The U.
sentences.chinese: 目前的发展只是刮伤表面什么是可能的。

sentences.english: It can also avoid the surface scratch on meat during process so as to better protect the natural meat structure.
sentences.chinese: 同时避免原料肉在工艺过程中的表面刮伤。

sentences.english: Always use a new blade to avoid scratching the glass.
sentences.chinese: 记住要使用新刀片以防止玻璃刮伤。

sentences.english: Because of the scratch, the desk can only be sold at a low price.
sentences.chinese: 因为刮伤，这桌子只能以很低的价格卖出。

sentences.english: Are slip sheets used to separate each panel to prevent scratches?
sentences.chinese: 每片板之间是否有分隔胶片以避免刮伤？

sentences.english: Scratches or abrasions which remove texture are not acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 会磨去纹路的刮伤或磨损不可允收。

sentences.english: He scratched his hands badly while pruning the rose bushes.
sentences.chinese: 他修剪玫瑰时双手刮伤得很厉害。

definition: to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to gash/to cut/gash/cut
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
a scratch
to scrape one's car against sth/to sideswipe
to injure by scratching or clawing
to make dirty/to defile/to smear
to knock against/to bump into/to have a disagreement/to clash
to fall and smash into pieces
wear and tear/abrasion
to damage/to injure
(of sth sharp) to snag (one's stockings etc)
barb/whiskers
to injure oneself in a fall
dent/indentation/notch/pitting
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
